column3: â€œI would not recommend this specific sativa if you are predisposed to anxiety! I have an anxiety disorder, but yet I tend to do okay with most sativas - this one, however, gave me a *lot* of initial paranoia and a small panic attack. This period of anxiety only lasted about 20-30 minutes, but it was extremely uncomfortable, and I will refrain from this strain in the future.â€

â€œThe Candy Jack I picked up from Greenleaf Wellness in Berkeley was cured just right, moderately sticky buds, stems crisply (but not too crisply) snap when bent, really beautiful nose out of the bag, sweet, candy-like (like the Jolly Rancher cherry sticks I dug as a kid) but musky enough to exhibit a faint skunkiness, probably from the Jack Herer side of the strain.  

This is a strong, but not overpowering, smoke. ...â€

â€œI actually really enjoyed this strain. I was concerned because of the high THC level that i might be a little too high too fast, but it all worked out. I was surprisingly not paranoid at all and I believe this is my new favorite stativa.â€

â€œusually don't write reviews, but got my hands on some candy jack the other night. one of my most memorable highs. smoked a few bong packs and i was all smiles. extremely happy high. lots of laughing, got me higher than usual. 10/10 would recommendâ€

â€œIâ€™ve been smoking this via pen before working out, and I have been had the greatest experience in the gym ever. Lifting more weight then usual, at more reps, without the soreness after. Keeps me focused and energized. One of my favorite strains.â€

â€œFirst of all, this strain is no doubt an offspring of Jack Herer. It only took me about 5 puffs from a pipe to feel its dizzying effects and sudden happiness kick in. At the same time, there's a small body tingle eminating from my spine out to my extremities. Perfect for those seeking daytime pain/depression relief. Only downside is I got too dizzy and went hazy for about 30 minutes. No worries though, awoke feeling ...â€
â€œLove it.  Had some before work.  Mind has been focused and creative all day.  Made me very productive.   Definitely getting more!â€
â€œThe first thing that caught my attention was the extremely sweet smell, couldn't stay away from it ever since. Very uplifting high, smooth and tasty hits.â€

â€œMy main use for medicinal marijuana is chronic anxiety.  I've been experimenting with rare sativa-dominant strains with high ratio of CBD:THC to stay relaxed through the day, but while even those relieve my worries, they leave me feeling somewhat numb to life during the high.  CANDY JACK COMPLETELY SHIFTS MY MOOD AND ENERGY LEVELS from ya know
column4: I think I'll stay inside today and watch tv by myself" to "WHO'S COMMING...â€"

column3: â€œThis strain gave me the ability to eat and eat. Definite Sativa..with the head high leaving your body and mind both uplifted. At least until you eat, then, it had me fall asleep about 45 minutes later. Helped with pain a bit and depression and the happy, giggly uplifted feeling is definitely felt. I definitely can see how this strain would increase anxiety in people with disorders/disabilities in this area. Overall, ...â€
â€œAmazingâ€
â€œCandyJack stole my heart away from Blue Dream. It helps so much with my health and wellbeing. It's my new go-to daytime smoke.â€
â€œOverall a great strain, I tend to save it for the evening, as it has a heavy crash and gives me some interesting dreams.â€

â€œThis strain is amazing. I smoked a couple joints of this last night as mixed with some green crack, by far one of the best highs I have ever had. It was like a million little tingles all through mead and my body, relieved me of any social anxiety, helped me with my music, and it lasted a long time too. Will be picking this up again!â€

â€œWell I'm on this right now and what can I say it's a beautiful strain its sent being a really strong pine is wonderful thing and over all it's a great body high in just relaxed <3 well that's allâ€
â€œI think this strain has a nootropic effect. Boosts your mood and helps you think/tackle projects. I could program Python on this stuff lol! Really great lightweight cannabis.â€
â€œa dose of reality with this one feels like a true jack I highly recommend itâ€
â€œOne of my personal favorite strains. The smell is such a potent and sour jack smell and smokes extremely smooth! Leaves the room with a immense aroma after one bowl! Definitely recommend trying!â€

â€œAbsolutely in love. My dude told me I had two choice, kick back and chill or kick back and game, and I'm more of the gaming type. Candy Jack has me alert and able to focus, while also relaxed. Cotton mouth is rough, but so worth it.â€

â€œThis is one of my favorite day time strains, I'm immediately relieved of my pain and my mind goes to a happier creative place.  The flavor is really nice, which is important to me..  Great for relief of fatigue as well, better than a cup of coffee!â€

â€œThis is a great daytime strain if you smoke just a couple hits, but it's deceivingly potent. The indica-dominant hybrid sunk #1 comes out in Candy Jack's relaxing, stress relieving effects, while still giving you that focused, feel-good high that Jack Herer is known for. By far this is one my favorites due to its sheer versatility.â€

â€œEnergizing, slightly hallucinogenic. I wouldnâ€™t use at bedtime, but I would use with a group of old friends to stir up some laughter.â€

â€œThis is a sativa for sure! It's a very concentrated head high, but it sure does help me stay focused and productive. Great wake and bake bud, in fact, it goes great with coffee! Not to mention I have a greater sense of well being, and it makes me really happy. I don't recommend it if you have anxiety or panic attacks because it is a concentrated head high. It sure does taste like cotton candy though!â€

â€œEither the person who sold it to me got it wrong or this thing affects me differently than the majority but I smoke it for 3 times now and it shuts me down completely. I fall asleep on the couch and wake up few hours later with a bad hangover.â€

â€œDid a few dabs of candy jack. Hit me pretty hard, mostly feel disconnected from my body and in tune completely with my mind. Sat down focused on drawing for quite a bit, simultaneously listened to Fleetwood Mac. Would recommend.â€
â€œEasily one of my top favorite sativa's. It makes you feel very up and alive while being super relaxed. The main thing is how happy and euphoric it makes you. You just felt on top of the world.â€

â€œA lovely strain. As soon as I opened the container I was hit with the sweet and citrusy aroma of the Candy Jack and I really did feel like a kid in a candy store! I can't wait to try it with my vaporizer because even smoking this strand is smooth. The effects- a very euphoric, energy filled high. It's a very up-in-the-clouds kind of high but I can still stay focused and awake. Definitely recommend!â€

â€œSecond time with Candy Jack. I decided to cut it with some tea since my last experience was too intense for my liking. I did a 50/50 blend of Candy Jack with some Chamomile tea. The flavor was light, and the buzz is mild leaving me functional. I was able to get up and start moving again as I was feeling really tired and run down.â€
â€œnot a fan. have to mix it with other potent buds to get a good high. not even going to fill out the rest of this reviewâ€

â€œnot going to get this again. good flavor, but not my kind of high. gives me headaches and belly aches and makes me miss my beloved indica. not bad if you haven't smoked in a while.... my tolerance is too high for this strain to work properly.â€

â€œFor me being a huge jack herer fan , I decided to try candy jack. It is a  good potent strain. It taste smooth and fruity. It haves a very sweet aroma. I really like it so far.â€

â€œive been smokin as normal the last few days with candy jack. and as all good nothing to brag about but still real good. then yesterday i got up with a wake and bake,,,,, and i got freakin ripped! i was nervous and uncomfortable. im not sure if it was the smoke or some stress ive been feeling. its been along time since ive had such a dark anxiety .

BUY AGAIN:  ill think about itâ€
